titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T20:11-0400

did.unittitle: The reminiscences of Frederic René Coudert, 1949, 1950.
did.abstract: The interviewers' questions have been omitted from this oral history, and no editorial insertions have been made other than the brief synopsis of the donor's activities and the index.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Acquired from Columbia University Oral History Research Office, 1972.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: No part of this work may be reproduced or transmitted in any form by any means, electronic or mechanical, including photocopying and recording or by any information storage or retrieval system, without permission in writing from the Oral History Research Office, Columbia University.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals in Columbia University Oral History Research Office.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: In 1897, Frederic R. Coudert and his father, Frederic René Coudert, Sr., became the first pair of father and son lawyers to argue cases before the U.S. Supreme court in a single day.
